thread.title: Eric Johnson: Why Is Acoustic Guitar WAY More Difficult Than Electric [News]
thread.title_full: Eric Johnson: Why Is Acoustic Guitar WAY More Difficult Than Electric [News]

title: Eric Johnson: Why Is Acoustic Guitar WAY More Difficult Than Electric [News]
text:
Posted 8 hours ago 6 
Eric Johnson recently explained why acoustic guitars require way more effort in certain areas, telling Guitarist Magazine : 
"Absolutely [acoustic guitar is less forgiving than an electric guitar]! 
"It's funny, I was just waking up this morning going, 'I've been practicing for this tour that's coming up in a few weeks and I'm so beat up, because I've been practicing acoustic all day long for the last week.' 
"It is less forgiving, I think, for a variety of reasons. First off, if you're out there doing it by yourself, all of a sudden you have a solo instrument that's got to articulate bass, rhythm and melody, so you've got two or three things going on at once and, right there, that's a challenge for me. 
"Then, adding to that, if you want to try and do fingerpicking, it is so different than an electric guitar." 
The guitarist noted during the rest of the chat: "I started on electric. I started playing when I was 11 and I didn't start playing acoustic till I was about 17. I got my first acoustic and started dabbling around with it, writing songs and stuff. I would play it a little bit in electric shows and stuff and then I started getting a little more serious about it in my late 20s." 
Eric Johnson released an all-acoustic album titled "EJ" back in October. You can check out the "Water Under the Bridge" single below.
